intro: [WRONG START] Embilia arfakensis, commonly known as the African embelia, is a small shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and ecological studies.
